EmailTemplate.name: ITM.Send Email 1.Email 1
EmailTemplate.subject: Keep that face-to-face teller service…at the ITM
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
${CTAText} <[[${CTAURL}?${url-parameter}]]> <[[https://ncrevent.webex.com/mw3300/mywebex/default.do?nomenu=true&siteurl=ncrevent&service=6&rnd=0.5837164398039255&main_url=https%3A%2F%2Fncrevent.webex.com%2Fec3300%2Feventcenter%2Fevent%2FeventAction.do%3FtheAction%3Ddetail%26%26%26EMK%3D4832534b00000004138c67e94d6a8af6a77190069926876158f7250cc9b3eab7b737672a013cdc8a%26siteurl%3Dncrevent%26confViewID%3D161323712190090491%26encryptTicket%3DSDJTSwAAAAQAZdtuxOai2W9AVce9M2mxXVbuLgVUzOZs6k4U5M0CsQ2%26]]>Due to the coronavirus, it can be challenging for financial institutions to offer face-to-face interaction with customers while enabling social distancing.
But one technology that makes it possible in the new normal for banking, is the Interactive Teller Machine or ITM.
With ITMs, {{company.Company Name:default=your}} customers can speak to a teller via two-way video, providing a visual connection, but in a much lower-contact way. An ITM also enables your tellers to work remotely—helping you keep business continuity at a critical time.
From reducing wait times and expanding hours to migrating routine, expensive transactions to the self-service channel, they’re fast becoming a key differentiator in a market facing unusual circumstances. ${CTAText2} <[[${CTAURL}?${url-parameter}]]>
